speaker: Carney
text: This is the lounge.  And through there is the dining area where the rehearsal dinner will be.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, this is lovely.  Say, have you seen the bride-to-be yet? I'd like to have a word with her.

speaker: Carney
text: No, I haven't.

speaker: Donny
text: So, I thought we'd have the toast right before desert.

speaker: Daphne
text: Dr. Crane!

speaker: Frasier
text: Gosh Daphne, I was wondering where you'd gotten to yesterday.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, after the caterer's, I went straight to Donny's so we could leave bright and early together.  It's lovely up here, isn't it?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes.

speaker: Donny
text: Anybody else want something from the bar? [_To bartender_] Uh, Scotch, rocks.

speaker: Daphne
text: Donny, it's barely noon!

speaker: Donny
text: Isn't that when your mom said she'd be here?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_to bartender_] Give him a double.

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne, I was actually hoping that I could-

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, I'll have whatever he's having.

speaker: Daphne
text: Roz!

speaker: Roz
text: I don't even know why I agreed to come to this wedding.  Hi, Daphne.  I was all set to drive up here myself, when I think, "Wait a minute!  I can't walk into that lobby alone, what if my ex-boyfriend's here?"  So I agree to drive up with _Simon_. There I am, standing on the curb with my garment bag and what does he pull up in?  Your father's Winnebago!

speaker: Roz
text: Thank you.  Don't go anywhere. [_to the others_] Next thing I know, we're headed down the highway, in the wrong direction, towards the airport.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey!  I wasn't kidding. [_to Daphne_] Turns out he's promised to ferry your entire family up here.

speaker: Daphne
text: All fourteen of them?

speaker: Roz
text: Fifteen.  Your Aunt Ida got the weekend off from the bakery. Judging by the size of her, it'll be the first Saturday they turn a profit.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Donny, maybe you could take Roz out for a walk in that rejuvenating country air?  While I have a word with your fiancee?

speaker: Donny
text: Come on Roz, let's go.

speaker: Roz
text: You don't mind if I just take this with me, do you?

speaker: Barkeep
text: Well, uh...

speaker: Roz
text: I didn't think so.

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne, I wanted you to know that I am just completely devastated by what happened.

speaker: Daphne
text: It's all right, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's just that when I advised you to have a chat with Niles, I had no idea that he'd run off and get married.

speaker: Daphne
text: I know you're concerned for me, but I'm fine.  I thought about it all last night and I realize that what I was feeling was just wedding jitters.  I do love your brother, but I'm in love with Donny.

speaker: Frasier
text: You're not just putting on a brave face?

speaker: Daphne
text: No.  I'm a bit embarrassed now, making you worry for no reason...

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, it's all right, Daphne.  It's what I do.

speaker: Daphne
text: You've always been such a wonderful friend.  In fact, I brought this for the honeymoon, [_takes the '45 Petrus out of her bag_] but I'd like you to have it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Daphne, I couldn't.

speaker: Daphne
text: No, Donny and I aren't wine drinkers.

speaker: Frasier
text: I wouldn't dream of it, really.

speaker: Daphne
text: All right then, I'll keep it.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_reaching out_] Oh, now I've hurt your feelings.  Here... [_They laugh_] Oh gosh, Daphne.  I tell you what: I promise that when I do drink this, I'll be thinking of you.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, come here.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Daph...

speaker: Mum
text: There's my baby!

speaker: Daphne
text: Mummy!

speaker: Daphne
text: Mum, this is...

speaker: Mum
text: Oh, I know who he is, love. [_To Frasier_] I want to thank you, Donny, for rescuing my daughter from that horrible Dr. Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, actually...

speaker: Mum
text: Every time I call her, I'm not on the phone five minutes, before that tyrant is ordering her to hang up. [_To bartender_] Cup of tea, please.  Thought my daughter might get me one, but she didn't. [_She sits_] Oh, this seat's worse than that Winnebago!  Though not half as uncomfortable as that sardine- tin of a room you arranged for me.

speaker: Mum
text: Oh, God, can't bear the smell of that, take it away. Reminds me of the salmon they served on that airplane. Oh, if it doesn't have me hurling me guts out, it'll be by God's own intervention.  Now, give your new mom a kiss, Donny.

speaker: Daphne
text: Actually, Mum, this isn't Donny.

speaker: Donny
text: [_entering_] Oh, is this Mum?

speaker: Daphne
text: This is Donny!

speaker: Donny
text: Hi!

speaker: Mum
text: Well, come here, let's have a good look at you. [_To Frasier_] We were starting to think our Daphne would never find herself a young man. [_Looks at Donny_] And I see she hasn't.  But, beggars can't be choosers. [_Gets up_] Well, I'm gonna see if your father's stomach is feeling any better.  He keeps saying it's tension!  What he's got to be tense about, I'll never know.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_cheerfully_] I was worried she'd be in one of her dark moods. **THE REHEARSAL DINNER** _Scene Two - The Lounge - Evening  FADE IN: Frasier is sitting at the bar.  Martin and Donny come in from the dining area.  Other guests can be heard through the doors._

speaker: Donny
text: Boy, Daphne's brothers know how to let loose, don't they?

speaker: Martin
text: I'll say.  Now listen, about their names: the one who'll eat anything on a bet, that's Nigel...

speaker: Donny
text: No, no, that's Peter.  Nigel's the one whose band-aid he ate. See you later.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Fras.  Had enough?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yeah.  I think I hit my limit when I looked down in the middle of my toast and there was a man chewing on my boutonni�re.

speaker: Martin
text: Ah, God, it's been a hell of a week.  I STILL can't get over Niles and Mel.

speaker: Frasier
text: Didn't see that one coming.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, at least he say she makes him happy.  So, there's nothin' you can do about it, right?

speaker: Frasier
text: Actually...

speaker: Martin
text: Fras!  Don't even think about trying to talk him out of it. He's married, end of story.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's really not that simple Dad.  You see... Ah, I shouldn't be talking to you about this.

speaker: Martin
text: Is this about Daphne?

speaker: Frasier
text: Why do you say that?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, come on.  I've got eyes, I know something's going on. I've seen the way she's been looking at him.

speaker: Frasier
text: She found out how Niles has felt about her all these years.

speaker: Martin
text: You're kidding!  How'd she find out?

speaker: Frasier
text: That's not important right now, Dad.  The problem is that she told me she thinks she might have the same feelings for him.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, geez...

speaker: Frasier
text: 'Course then Niles shows up married, now she says it's just jitters.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, you can't tell Niles all this, he says he's happy with Mel.

speaker: Frasier
text: She says she's happy with Donny.  But I'm not sure I believe either one of them.

speaker: Martin
text: Just remember Fras, there are two marriages on the line here. So, before you get involved, you better make damn sure you know what you're doing.

speaker: Martin
text: Who blabbed?  Roz?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, but she feels terrible. _Simon enters with his sleeves rolled up.  He pats the boys on the back, also drying his wet hands on their jackets._

speaker: Simon
text: Hello, boys!  Pack of smokes, please, barkeep.  Ah, lovely spot, isn't it?  I just took a nice little stroll outside, around the wishing well.

speaker: Barkeep
text: That'll be four dollars, please.

speaker: Simon
text: Oh, yeah, right.

speaker: Simon
text: This oughta cover it.

speaker: Roz
text: Tim!  What a surprise!  I had no idea you'd be here.  Simon? Come here.

speaker: Simon
text: Oh, showtime.

speaker: Roz
text: Simon, this is my old friend Tim.  He's a computer programmer.

speaker: Simon
text: Oh, what a coincidence, with me owning my own software company.

speaker: Tim
text: Really?  What sort of applications are you focused on?

speaker: Simon
text: Voice recognition, data encryption, a little something I'm working on for NASA, can't discuss that one.

speaker: Tim
text: Very impressive.  And Roz?  Are you still producing?

speaker: Simon
text: Oh, I'll say she is! _He gives her a smack on the behind.  She gives him a shocked glare and they go into the dining area.  Tim goes out the front as Daphne and Donny enter._

speaker: Donny
text: Mind if we join you guys?

speaker: Martin
text: Sure.

speaker: Frasier
text: Please, there's plenty of room.

speaker: Martin
text: [_to bartender_] Uh, give me a beer, please

speaker: Daphne
text: Sorry we didn't get a toast out of you, Mr. Crane.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, I'm sorry.  I really wanted to, Daphne, but I just felt kind of awkward.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, It's all right.  Anyway, I should be toasting you. I'm gonna miss you, you rotten old sod.

speaker: Barkeep
text: Ballantine okay?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, yeah, that's my beer!

speaker: Martin
text: Yes.  You know, I just found out they're gonna quit making this stuff?

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah.

speaker: Frasier
text: There's the end of an era.

speaker: Martin
text: That's right.  It's gonna be one sad day when I get down to my last one.  You know, it's funny.  You get used to having something in your life.  It's part of your day, you just take it for granted.  Then, suddenly it's gone and you realize how much it meant to you. _Daphne, moved, puts her hand on his arm, Martin makes a little "Oh, go on" gesture.  Niles enters from the dining area with Mel._

speaker: Niles
text: Hey, guys!  Great party.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Mel, why don't you take my seat, I'm going to sit here and just enjoy the music.

speaker: Martin
text: I'll join you, Fras.  Take my beer over there?  I just want to go to the rest room.

speaker: Donny
text: You know, seeing as how this is my last night as a carefree bachelor, [_to Mel_] would you care to dance, Miss?

speaker: Mel
text: I'd love to.

speaker: Niles
text: Uh, oh. _Mel and Donny go to the dance floor, Niles sits down next to Daphne._

speaker: Niles
text: Well, you certainly picked the perfect spot for your wedding.

speaker: Daphne
text: It is, isn't it?  We're doing the ceremony in the garden.

speaker: Niles
text: Mmm, it'll be beautiful.

speaker: Daphne
text: I love this song.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, where are my manners?  Would you like to dance?

speaker: Daphne
text: All right!  Give us a chance to keep an eye on those two. _They go to the floor and start dancing.  As the scene progresses they get closer and smoother._

speaker: Niles
text: Ahh, it's been a while since we danced together.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, it has.

speaker: Niles
text: Thanks for dinner.  It's been a wonderful evening.

speaker: Daphne
text: It's one of those times you just don't want to end. _They end up cheek to cheek, almost melting in each others arms, just as the number finishes._

speaker: Donny
text: Excuse me, sir.  Mind if I cut in?

speaker: Niles
text: Not at all.

speaker: Donny
text: Thank you.

speaker: Niles
text: Darling. _He and Mel begin to dance.  Frasier has been watching this and sees Niles glance at Daphne then, as he turns away, Daphne look at Niles.  FADE OUT.  END OF ACT THREE  ACT FOUR  Scene One - Frasier's Hotel Room  FADE IN:  In Frasier's hotel room, which has connecting doors to those of Donny/Daphne and Niles/Mel.  A draped door leads to a balcony. There are twin beds with wing chairs at the foot of each.  The door opens and Frasier and Niles come in._

speaker: Niles
text: What in the world was so urgent that you brought me all the way up here?

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, just sit down.  There's something I need to discuss with you.

speaker: Frasier
text: I was watching you on the dance floor just now, and the look in your eyes was unmistakable.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, can you blame me?  Mel's quite the little dancer.  Of course her vertigo rules out any serious twirling, but...

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, I'm talking about Daphne.  The way you were looking at her... well, it just breaks my heart.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, it was one thing when you were beating this drum the other day, but I'm married now.  What's it going to take to convince you that I am over her?

speaker: Frasier
text: She knows.

speaker: Niles
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne knows that you have feelings for her.  She's known for some time.

speaker: Niles
text: How?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's a long story. but... I think Roz said something. Anyway, she knows!

speaker: Niles
text: I knew you thought my marriage to Mel was hasty, but to poison it like this... [_He gets up and heads for the door_] I'm not going to listen to this.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, Daphne feels the same way about you!

speaker: Frasier
text: At least I think she does.  She told me as much the other day and then denied once you got married.  But I saw the way she was looking at you downstairs just now.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, my God.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, I'm not in the habit of breaking up people's marriages. But how could I not tell you?  You're my brother, I love you.

speaker: Mel
text: [_from outside_] Niles, darling?

speaker: Niles
text: [_opening the door_] Yes, honey.

speaker: Mel
text: You left with our only room key.

speaker: Niles
text: Here, I'll let you through this way.  I am so sorry.

speaker: Mel
text: Oh, it's all right.  You have a whole lifetime to make it up to me. _She kisses him and goes into their room.  Niles closes the door behind her and begins gasping for air.  He is in full-blown, hyperventilating panic-attack mode.  He staggers to a chair and sits._

speaker: Niles
text: This is awful.  I love Mel.  It's just...

speaker: Frasier
text: I know, I know...

speaker: Niles
text: [_thinks for a moment_] I have to talk to Daphne.  Come with me. Maybe while I'm speaking to her, you can find some way to occupy - [_they open the door, revealing -_] Donny!  Daphne!

speaker: Donny
text: Hey, doc.  Things are getting a little too wild for us down there.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh well, it's just as well.  We all have a very big day tomorrow.  About that, Daphne could I have a word with you?

speaker: Daphne
text: All right.

speaker: Donny
text: Yeah, you go ahead.  I'm just gonna get out of these shoes and I'll see you in a few minutes.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I'll just brave the hordes, see if I can't get myself a nightcap.  Uh, good night.

speaker: Niles
text: So, Daphne...

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes?

speaker: Niles
text: May I offer you something to drink?

speaker: Daphne
text: Um, no thank you.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, all right.  Anyway, Daphne...

speaker: Daphne
text: Perhaps an Orangina.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, all right, maybe I'll join you.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_sitting in one of the chairs_] Funny thing about Orangina: I never buy Orangina at home, but whenever I'm in a hotel and there's a mini-bar, it's the first thing I go for. Orangina... _Niles has gotten two bottles from the mini-bar and gives her one. He sits in the other chair so they are side by side and not facing each other._

speaker: Niles
text: Anyway, I was just talking to Frasier about a conversation you two had.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, dear!

speaker: Niles
text: No, no.  Don't get upset.

speaker: Daphne
text: I specifically asked him not to say anything.  What was he thinking?

speaker: Niles
text: [_getting up to follow her_] No, I'm glad he told me.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, yes!  So we can have a big talk about it!  That's what you psychiatrists always do, drag everything out into the open so we can work through it.  No matter how awkward it might be.  Well, I just don't see the point!

speaker: Niles
text: No, Daphne, I'm glad he told me - because I love you. _Daphne is stunned.  Then Martin comes through the door, with wet hair._

speaker: Martin
text: Ah, excuse me.

speaker: Niles
text: Dad...

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, I'm sorry.  I thought you were in here with Frasier. The boys are playing a game called "William Tell" with the seltzer hose.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh.  Uh, well, anyway... why don't you two go on doing whatever you were doing and I'll just, uh, I'll be down in the lobby. By the fireplace.

speaker: Daphne
text: Dr. Crane, you shouldn't say such things.

speaker: Niles
text: It's the truth.  Lord knows, I have tried to deny it, tried to pretend that I am over you, but not a day has gone by when I haven't thought of you.  Your smile, your beautiful eyes, what it would be like to hold your hands and ask you the question I never dared ask!

speaker: Donny
text: [_coming through the connecting door_] What's the difference between a blister and a boil?

speaker: Daphne
text: Donny!

speaker: Donny
text: God, I took my shoe off and it was like I was growing another ankle bone down here.  Doc, you went to med school, what am I supposed to do with this?  Lance it or something?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, well, I.  You know, as I recall the best thing for that would be to soak it in tepid water for at least half an hour.

speaker: Donny
text: All right.   What luck!  Can you imagine a worse thing to have happen to me on the night before my wedding?

speaker: Daphne
text: I don't understand!  How come you never said anything before?

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne, I wanted to.  I just... the timing just never seemed right.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, and the timing's right now?  I'm twelve hours from the altar and you're on your honeymoon!

speaker: Niles
text: I would never have gotten married if I thought there was the slightest chance that you shared my feelings.  Trust me, Daphne, say the word and I will leave Mel in a heartbeat.

speaker: Mel
text: [_coming through HER connecting door_] Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: Darling!

speaker: Mel
text: I was just looking over these brochures for our honeymoon. Hi Daphne! [_To Niles_] Now, the Denali has a step-down tub, but the Greeley has the most romantic view of the Grand Canal. What do you think?

speaker: Niles
text: I think a woman with your exquisite taste can handle this decision.

speaker: Mel
text: [_to Daphne_] Oh, he says that now.  Wait 'til the honeymoon's over.

speaker: Daphne
text: Don't the doors in this bloody place lock?!

speaker: Niles
text: I'll get this one, you get that one.

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne?  It is not too late for us.  I meant what I said when I said I would leave her.

speaker: Daphne
text: That's crazy!

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, it's NOT crazy.  Not if you feel the same way I do. But I need you to tell me, and I can accept it if the answer is "No."  How do you feel about me?

speaker: Simon
text: Pardon.

speaker: Daphne
text: Simon!  How did you get in here?

speaker: Simon
text: Well, Frasier loaned me his key, in a manner of speaking.

speaker: Simon
text: I have to get some things from the mini-bar, here.  Don't want to get caught empty-handed when last call comes.

speaker: Simon
text: You're not havin' a last call of your own in here, are you, Stilts?

speaker: Daphne
text: Of course not!

speaker: Simon
text: Riiight.  This isn't the chap whose baby you're havin', is it?

speaker: Niles
text: Excuse me?!

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm not pregnant!

speaker: Nigel
text: [_coming in the door_] Oi, Simon!  Bit o' bad news.

speaker: Daphne
text: Nigel!

speaker: Nigel
text: Peter's gotten sick into the piano, so we've been asked to vacate the bar.

speaker: Simon
text: Bloody hell, Daphne!  Nice hotel you picked!   Well Nigel, I'm sure Daphne won't mind if we help ourselves to the contents of her mini-bar.  'Way you go.

speaker: Nigel
text: Right. [_Shouting down the hall_] Give us a hand, lads!

speaker: Daphne
text: Nigel-! _A veritable horde comes pouring through the door -- Daphne's brothers, followed by Mum and some other guests. _

speaker: Daphne
text: Stephen, Peter, David, Michael, Billy!  What are you all doing in here?

speaker: Mum
text: So here you all are.  What is the point of bringing the party down to the Winnebago when there's a perfectly nice room right here?

speaker: Daphne
text: You're not moving the party in here!

speaker: Mum
text: Oh, Daphne, don't get your blood pressure up!  You've got your baby to think of.  Here, have a drink and relax. _Daphne heads for the balcony.  CUT TO: the balcony. Niles is standing at the rail, looking out.  Daphne comes through the door behind him._

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm sorry about all that.

speaker: Niles
text: I must be in love.  It doesn't even bother me that you come with them.  Lovely night isn't it?

speaker: Daphne
text: Mmm.

speaker: Niles
text: The stars are out, nice breeze, [_he inhales deeply_] mmm, night-blooming jasmine.  Of course there's the beautiful girl...

speaker: Daphne
text: Dr. Crane, I still haven't answered your question.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, I know.  That's why I keep talking.  In case I don't get the answer I want, I can at least make this moment last a little longer. [_Then, for a moment his old fussy self_] Not sure if it's jasmine or orange blossoms.  You know, a lot of times...

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, for God's sake, Dr. Crane!

speaker: Niles
text: [_as the kiss breaks_] I think you can call me "Niles" now. _He leans in and they kiss again.  Then Daphne brings her hands down and pushes back._

speaker: Daphne
text: [_shaking her head_] No.  I don't think I can.  I do love you, but I can't do this.

speaker: Niles
text: Wh-, whe-, uh... I know it will be difficult, but I will get a divorce, and you can call off the wedding.

speaker: Daphne
text: I can't!  Donny is a dear and wonderful man, and I made a promise to him.  And Mel!  You made more than a promise to her!  And we're supposed to forget that?  And for what? We have no idea how we'd be together.  For heaven's sake, we've never even been on a date.

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne, take it from someone who knows: you don't want to spend half your life thinking about a chance you didn't take.

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm sorry.  My mind's made up.  I think we should say good night now.

speaker: Niles
text: [_finally says_] Good night, Daphne.

speaker: Daphne
text: Good night, Dr. Crane. _She goes back in, leaving Niles standing alone.  FADE OUT.  Scene Two - The Winnebago.  FADE IN:  Niles, looking VERY dejected, is sitting in the driver's seat of the Winnebago.  The door opens and Frasier and Martin come in._

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Don't tell me the ceremony's over already.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, no, it hasn't even started yet.

speaker: Frasier
text: Actually, we saw you heading over this way and we thought you could use some company.

speaker: Niles
text: I just felt like some privacy.  This is one wedding I couldn't see myself handling very well.

speaker: Martin
text: Ah, lots of people cry at weddings.

speaker: Niles
text: Yeah, but not so many end up wailing and rending their garments.  I appreciate your coming over but I'd hate for you to miss it on my account.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, actually it's been delayed a bit.  You see, the justice of the peace started out asking the witnesses to step forward, and three of Daphne's brothers just ran off into the woods.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah. _He opens the door.  A waiter is there.  He is carrying a tray with the '45 Petrus and three glasses._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello.

speaker: Waiter
text: Here's your wine, sir.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, thank you very much, young man. [_tipping him_] And this is for you.  Thank you.

speaker: Niles
text: What is this?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I got to thinking about our old friend Morrie and how he kept this bottle of wine his entire life, waiting for a special occasion.  And then I thought, "What occasion am I saving it for?"  And then I thought about what a courageous thing you did last night, taking that chance. And that's worth a toast. [_Starts to open the wine_]

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, Frasier, don't...

speaker: Frasier
text: No, too late, the foil is pierced.

speaker: Martin
text: I know this thing between you and Mel seems kinda bad right now...

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, Dad, why do you say that?  Just because I spent the third night of my marriage proposing to another woman?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I'm just saying a marriage can survive all kinds of stuff.  You know?  You might still be happy.  Ten years from now, this could all be ancient history.

speaker: Niles
text: I hope you're right.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right gentlemen, here we are now.  [_Passes out the wine_] Dad, Niles, allow me. [_Raises his glass_] To better days.

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, where did Morrie keep this?

speaker: Martin
text: In his wine rack.

speaker: Frasier
text: Which is...?

speaker: Martin
text: In the boiler room.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, lord.  I'll just save this little treat for later.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, well, thanks for the thought.  You two should be running along.  I'll be fine.

speaker: Martin
text: All right.  Well, take care, Niles.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I saw a waiter, passing champagne just outside. I'll have him bring you a glass so you can...

speaker: Niles
text: Get the taste out, yes.  Thank you, Frasier. _Frasier and Martin exit.  Niles leans back in the seat, once again looking very melancholy.  There is a knock at the door._

speaker: Niles
text: Come in.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello.

speaker: Niles
text: [_rising_] Daphne...

speaker: Daphne
text: I was wondering... if you might be free for a date?

speaker: Niles
text: [_rushing to embrace her_] Oh, my God, yes!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_separating them_] There's plenty of time for that later. Let's get this bloody boat moving! _Daphne rushes to the front passenger seat and Niles helps her with the skirts and train of her dress._

speaker: Niles
text: What, you mean now?

speaker: Daphne
text: There's about a hundred people back there I'm not so keen on seeing.

speaker: Niles
text: [_giddy_] Well, all right, let's go then. _He sits in the driver's seat and starts the engine, then grabs for the safety belt._

speaker: Niles
text: Fasten your seat belt, Daphne.
